briefdescription.para: Structure and bitfields for representing IP fragmentation. Used within an ip_packet_t.
Convert network byte order IP to a string form for display.

parameterdescription.para: character buffer to fill, should be at least 13 bytes

briefdescription.para: Convert a string IP to host byte order IP address.

simplesect.para: uint32_t IP in host byte order

briefdescription.para: Send IP packet to the ethernet driver.

parameterdescription.para: IP to send the packet to (255.255.255.255 for broadcast)
Sub-protocol encapsulated inside the packet, e.g. UDP, TCP

briefdescription.para: Get the current IP address. This could be allocated by DHCP or statically.

parameterdescription.para: IP address buffer, should be at least 4 bytes

simplesect.para: int nonzero if an IP address is available for use

briefdescription.para: Set DNS address This could be allocated by DHCP or statically.
Set gateway address This could be allocated by DHCP or statically.
Get DNS address This could be allocated by DHCP or statically.
Get gateway address This could be allocated by DHCP or statically.

Called from the local APIC timer interrupt 50 times a second. Attempts to resolve ARP requests for queued packets that we don't have ARP for yet, and retries ARP requests up to 3 times before dropping packets we cannot route.
